intro: Hieracium praecox subsp. brachypus, commonly known as the short-stemmed early hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are broadly ovate to lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, blooming from late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, grassy habitats and is often found in meadows and along riverbanks.
